dc:title:
From Union Square to Rome,
Chapter 13 - Your Three Objections
dc:creator: Dorothy Day
dc:description: Answers three objections of her brother to her faith: that religion is morbid, the Catholic belief in the presence of Christ in the Eucharist, and the problem of evil. Relies on St. Theresa of Avila, St. John of the Cross, and the scriptures to elaborate her faith and love of God.
